item.title: Atlantisâ€“SARIF: Reliable Validation for Static Analysis Reports
item.description:
ðŸ’¥ Escaping the Hell of False Positives

When it comes to bug-finding approaches, the field can be broadly divided into two categories: dynamic analysis and static analysis.

Dynamic analysisâ€”most notably fuzzingâ€”has already become an indispensable tool for security engineers, and it was also a core component of our Atlantis, where multiple fuzzing techniques were actively employed throughout the competition.

Static analysis, however, still struggles to gain trust. The main reason is simpleâ€”too many false positives 12.
